GENERAL INFORMATION
This agreement displays all lower-division courses required in the major: CSU Northridge courses on the left, approved (articulated) transfer
GENERAL INFORMATION
courses to the right.  General education (CSU-GE Breadth or IGETC or CSU Northridg GE) and upper-division courses are also required to complete
the bachelor's degree.
Completion of all coursework listed in this agreement is not mandatory prior to admission. For CSU Northridge Undergraduate Admission
Requirements refer to Upper Division Transfer
Some coursework may be satisfied by Advanced Placement exams completed in high school. Vist AP Credit for information.
Additional information about the major is available in the CSUN University Catalog
Questions regarding this agreement may be directed to Jonathan Charres, the CSUN Articulation Officer, by e-mail at: jonathan.charres@csun.edu
LIBERAL STUDIES - INTERDISCIPLINARY STUDIES INFORMATION
The Interdisciplinary Studies Option is designed for students interested in a broad liberal arts education. Students take courses in the language arts,
LIBERAL STUDIES - INTERDISCIPLINARY STUDIES INFORMATION
natural sciences, social sciences, and humanities.  General Education and Title V requirements are completed outside the major. However, students
may double-count six units between GE and the major.  Students interested in elementary education or special education should select the
Teacher Preparation Option instead of Interdisciplinary Studies.
As part of this option, students are required to choose one specialization track: Humanities; Human Rights; Sustainability; Russian Studies; China
Studies; Interdisciplinary.  There are lower division courses specific to each track.  See courses below.
Track A: Humanities: HUM 105; HUM 106; One from: ART 110, ART 112, ART 114, KIN 236/L, MUS 105, TH 110
Track B: Human Rights: SOC 150; PHIL 165; AFRS 271; AFRS 272; POLS 197
Track C: Sustainability: One from: RTM 251; URBS 150
Track D: Russian Studies: RUSS 101; RUSS 102; RUSS 201; RUSS 200 or RUSS 202
Track E: China Studies: CHIN 101; CHIN 102; CHIN 201; CHIN 202
Track F: Interdisciplinary Specialization or Minor: Requires approval of Liberal Studies advisor
For additional information please visit Liberal Studies or call (818) 677-3300. Students should complete a Liberal Studies Workshop before attending
CSUN. Students who have applied to CSUN and who have completed a workshop may schedule an appointment with an advisor after receiving an
evaluation from the Liberal Studies office.
